title: Containers & Breakpoints
subject: Bootstrap
learning_objectives: Responsive Breakpoints (sm, md, lg, xl, xxl)
theory:
## Responsive Control

### Containers
Containers center your content and provide padding.
1. `.container`: Fixed width. Steps in width at each breakpoint (540px, 720px...).
2. `.container-fluid`: Full width (100%) always.

### Breakpoints
Bootstrap uses class infixes to define *when* a layout applies.
* `xs` (None): <576px (Default, mobile)
* `sm`: ≥576px
* `md`: ≥768px (Tablets)
* `lg`: ≥992px (Laptops)
* `xl`: ≥1200px (Desktops)
* `xxl`: ≥1400px (Big Screens)

### Responsive Columns
`col-md-6` means "Take 6 columns (50%) on **Medium** screens and larger. On smaller screens, stack (100%)".

examples.output: Phone: 100% width. Tablet: 50% width. Desktop: 33% width.

common_mistakes.correction: The `xs` infix does not exist in Bootstrap 5 classes. It is implied. Just use `.col-6`.

interview_questions.question: What happens if I use `.col-6` without a breakpoint?
interview_questions.answer: It applies to ALL screen sizes, from mobile up to desktop. The element will always be 50% width.

real_world_use_cases.description: 1 item/row on phone (`col-12`), 2 items on tablet (`col-sm-6`), 4 items on desktop (`col-lg-3`).

summary: Breakpoints allow one codebase to serve phones and desktops perfectly.
